In the warmer months there's nothing I love more than a giant salad with ALL the veggies.. but let's be real, salad can be boring! This traditional greek salad is anything but boring. This easy salad is loaded with all the veggies, salty feta cheese and briny olives. Everything gets tossed with [olive oil](https://amzn.to/3VmzzWi) and some herbs for maximum flavor resulting in the BEST greek salad. Traditional Greek Salad It's done in under 10 minutes and perfect alongside [Greek Chicken Kabobs](https://thecleaneatingcouple.com/greek-chicken-kabobs/) or on its own. Why this is the Best Greek Salad Recipe This is one of our favorite quick and easy side dishes for the summer time. Here's why we love it: - Low Calorie & Filling: This salad is just about 100 calories for a cup. It's also super filling! - Veggie Loaded: Between the cucumbers and tomatoes - there is one serving of veggies for every serving of this salad. - Healthy & Flavorful: This recipe is loaded with healthy fats, veggies, and seasoning to make it a delicious side for any recipe! What is Greek Salad? Traditional Greek Salad is a light salad made with tomatoes, [kalamata olives](https://amzn.to/43vaV9H), cucumbers and feta. The salad gets tossed in a light [olive oil](https://amzn.to/3VmzzWi) dressing with herbs and spices. Greek Salad Ingredients: To make this salad you'll need: [kalamata olives](https://amzn.to/43vaV9H) - cherry tomatoes - cucumbers [pepper](https://amzn.to/3yqM5Kx) - fresh parsley How to make Greek Salad Making this salad is super easy to do. Here's how to make it: - Chop your olives, cherry tomatoes and cucumbers - In a large bowl mix chopped veggies and remaining ingredients - Stir until combined & enjoy! That's it! So simple! SUBSTITUTIONS FOR GREEK SALAD Olives: We haven't tried this recipe with any other olives besides [kalamata olives](https://amzn.to/43vaV9H). I'm not sure how it would taste with a substitute. Cherry Tomatoes: You can use finely chopped tomatoes or plum tomatoes. Regular tomatoes might result in a mushy salad. We recommend using cherry tomatoes. Cucumbers: We haven't made this recipe without cucumber but I think it would work. Feta: You can substitute feta with goat cheese or omit the cheese to make this dairy free. [Olive Oil](https://amzn.to/3VmzzWi): You can substitute [olive oil](https://amzn.to/3VmzzWi) with [avocado oil](https://amzn.to/3OUqCCu). Lemon Juice: Do not use bottled lemon juice. Use fresh lemon juice. You can substitute with 1 tablespoon [red wine vinegar](https://amzn.to/3CHYnRl). Chickpeas: If you want to add chickpeas, try our [Greek Chickpea Salad](https://thecleaneatingcouple.com/chickpea-salad/)! Dried Herbs: You can substitute dried herbs with fresh herbs. Use 2x the amount of fresh herbs. You can also use store bought Greek Salad Dressing or [Homemade Greek Dressing Recipe](https://thecleaneatingcouple.com/greek-salad-dressing/) and use it on the veggies/olive mixture. What do you serve with Greek Salad? Here are some of my favorite thing to serve this with: [Greek Grilled chicken marinated with [Greek Salad Dressing Recipe](https://thecleaneatingcouple.com/greek-salad-dressing/) How do you store this traditional greek salad recipe? Eat this salad fresh right after you make it. Refrigerator: Greek salad can stay in the fridge for up to 3 days. After that it will start to get a bit soggy and the veggies will not be as crisp. Frozen: Do not freeze this recipe. It will not be good if frozen. Can you double this Greek Salad Recipe? Yes, you can easily double this recipe. You can also cut it in half or triple the recipe. It would be great for serving at a picnic! What is the body of a greek salad? Most greek salads are made up of a mixture of tomatoes, cucumbers, olives and feta cheese. Some have other things added like chickpeas, artichoke hearts, or onions. What is Greek salad called in Greece? Greek salad is typically called Horiatiki or Xoriatiki in Greece. It means 'village salad' Traditional Greek Salad Recipe FAQ Typically an authentic Greek salad does not contain lettuce. It is usually a mixture of tomatoes, olives, onions and cucumbers. You can add lettuce to this if you'd like! Greek salad dressing is traditionally made of olive oil, red wine vinegar and dried spices like oregano, parsley and basil. It's a delicious greek vinaigrette. The difference between a green salad and a Greek salad is mainly lettuce. Typically a green salad has lettuce in it while a Greek salad does not have lettuce added to it. Greek salad isn't the healthiest salad but it is a very healthy salad! It's loaded with veggies, healthy fats and some protein from the cheese. Greek salad is a delicious healthy salad if you're looking for something to make! Greek Salad Recipe Ingredients - 1/2 cup [Kalamata olives](https://amzn.to/43vaV9H)chopped - 1.5 cups [cherry tomatoes](https://amzn.to/3INEXwG)quartered (1 pint) - 1.5 cups [cucumbers](https://amzn.to/3IM7S4m)quartered - 1/2 cup [crumbled feta](https://amzn.to/45ApJVN) - 1/2 tablespoon [olive oil](https://amzn.to/45BuX3v) - 1 tablespoon [lemon juice](https://amzn.to/45yZgrv)juice of half a lemon - 1/2 teaspoon [garlic powder](https://amzn.to/3IP4xBK) - 1/2 teaspoon [dried basil](https://amzn.to/3IOCNgw) - 1/2 teaspoon [dried oregano](https://amzn.to/43do9rt) - 1/4 teaspoon [black pepper](https://amzn.to/3owTfLB) - 1 teaspoon [fresh parsley](https://amzn.to/45ytew1) Instructions - Chop your olives, cherry tomatoes and cucumbers - In a large bowl mix chopped veggies and remaining ingredients - Stir until combined & enjoy!
